Description: Fungal infection is a common skin condition caused by fungi.
Allergy is an immune system reaction to a substance in the environment.
GERD (Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease) is a digestive disorder that affects the lower esophageal sphincter.
Chronic cholestasis is a condition where bile flow from the liver is reduced for a prolonged period.
Drug Reaction occurs when the body reacts adversely to a medication.
Peptic ulcer disease involves sores that develop on the inner lining of the stomach and small intestine.
AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome) is a disease caused by HIV that weakens the immune system.
Diabetes is a chronic condition that affects how the body processes blood sugar.
Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of the stomach and intestines, typically caused by a virus or bacteria.
Bronchial Asthma is a respiratory condition characterized by inflammation of the airways.
Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a common cardiovascular condition.
Migraine is a type of headache that often involves severe pain and sensitivity to light and sound.
Cervical spondylosis is a degenerative condition of the cervical spine.
Paralysis (brain hemorrhage) refers to the loss of muscle function due to bleeding in the brain.
Jaundice is a yellow discoloration of the skin and eyes, often indicating liver problems.
Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease affecting humans and other animals.
Chicken pox is a highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy rash.
Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms.
Typhoid is a bacterial infection that can lead to a high fever and gastrointestinal symptoms.
hepatitis A is a viral liver disease.
Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver.
Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation.
Hepatitis D is a serious liver disease caused by the hepatitis D virus.
Hepatitis E is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation.
Alcoholic hepatitis is inflammation of the liver due to alcohol consumption.
Tuberculosis is a bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs.
Common Cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract.
Pneumonia is an inflammatory condition affecting the air sacs in the lungs.
Dimorphic hemmorhoids(piles) is a condition characterized by swollen blood vessels in the rectum.
Heart attack is a sudden and severe reduction in blood flow to the heart muscle.
Varicose veins are enlarged, twisted veins that usually appear on the legs.
Hypothyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.
Hyperthyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone.
Hypoglycemia is a condition characterized by abnormally low blood sugar levels.
Osteoarthristis is a degenerative joint disease that affects the cartilage in joints.
Arthritis is inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness.
(Vertigo) Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo is a type of dizziness caused by specific head movements.
Acne is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
Urinary tract infection is an infection in any part of the urinary system.
Psoriasis is a chronic skin condition characterized by red, itchy, and scaly patches.
Impetigo is a highly contagious skin infection causing red sores that can break open.
Tularemia is a rare infectious disease caused by the bacterium Francisella tularensis.
Stroke occurs when blood flow to a part of the brain is interrupted, causing brain cells to die.
Lead poisoning is a condition caused by toxic levels of lead in the body, often from environmental exposure.
Sickle-cell anemia is a genetic blood disorder where red blood cells become misshapen and can block blood flow.
Myocardial infarction, or heart attack, occurs when blood flow to the heart muscle is blocked, causing tissue damage.
Rabies is a deadly viral infection that spreads through the bite of an infected animal.
Warkany syndrome is a rare genetic disorder characterized by physical malformations and developmental delays.
Celiac disease is an autoimmune disorder where ingestion of gluten leads to damage in the small intestine.
An abscess is a collection of pus that forms in tissues, organs, or spaces inside the body due to infection.
Perennial allergic conjunctivitis is a year-round allergic eye inflammation caused by allergens such as dust mites and pet dander.
Lyme disease is an infectious disease caused by the bacterium Borrelia burgdorferi, transmitted through tick bites.
Japanese encephalitis is a viral brain infection spread by mosquitoes in Asia and the western Pacific.
Hepatitis A is a viral liver disease.
Bronchitis is an inflammation of the bronchial tubes, leading to cough and mucus production.
Influenza, or the flu, is a viral infection that affects the respiratory system.
Multiple sclerosis is a chronic autoimmune disorder affecting the central nervous system.
Anthrax is a serious infectious disease caused by Bacillus anthracis, affecting the skin, lungs, and intestines.
A brain tumor is an abnormal growth of cells within the brain, which can be benign or malignant.
COVID-19 is a highly contagious respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
Lupus erythematosus is an autoimmune disease causing inflammation and damage to various body tissues.
Carpal tunnel syndrome is a condition caused by compression of the median nerve in the wrist, leading to pain and numbness.
Lymphoma is a type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system.
Insomnia is a sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
Goitre is an abnormal enlargement of the thyroid gland.
PCOS is a hormonal disorder causing enlarged ovaries with small cysts on the outer edges.
Rubella, or German measles, is a contagious viral infection preventable by vaccine.
Myopia, or nearsightedness, is a common vision condition where distant objects appear blurry.
Postpartum depression is a type of mood disorder that can affect women after childbirth.
Vitamin B12 deficiency can cause anemia and nervous system damage.
Heat-related illnesses include conditions like heat exhaustion and heat stroke caused by excessive heat exposure.
Melanoma is a serious type of skin cancer that develops in the cells that produce melanin.
Scrapie is a fatal, degenerative disease affecting the nervous system of sheep and goats.
Autism spectrum disorder is a developmental disorder affecting communication and behavior.
Sepsis is a life-threatening condition caused by the body's response to infection.
Mouth breathing is the act of inhaling and exhaling through the mouth instead of the nose.
Repetitive strain injury is a condition caused by repetitive movements leading to pain and damage to muscles and nerves.
Iron deficiency anemia is a condition where a lack of iron leads to a reduced number of red blood cells.
Porphyria refers to a group of disorders caused by abnormalities in the chemical steps leading to heme production.
Bubonic plague is a severe infection caused by the bacterium Yersinia pestis, characterized by swollen lymph nodes.
Strep throat is a bacterial infection causing inflammation and pain in the throat.
Ebola is a severe viral hemorrhagic fever caused by the Ebola virus.
Tonsillitis is inflammation of the tonsils, typically caused by viral or bacterial infections.
Colitis is inflammation of the inner lining of the colon.
Oral cancer refers to cancer that develops in any part of the mouth.
Leptospirosis is a bacterial infection that affects humans and animals, caused by bacteria of the genus Leptospira.
Urticaria, or hives, is a skin condition characterized by red, itchy welts.
Yellow fever is a viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, causing fever, chills, and jaundice.
Rheumatic fever is an inflammatory disease that can develop after a streptococcal infection.
Alcohol abuse is the harmful use of alcohol, while alcoholism is an addiction to alcohol.
Bleeding gums are a common sign of gum disease or gingivitis.
Thalassemia is a genetic blood disorder characterized by less hemoglobin and fewer red blood cells than normal.
Glaucoma is a group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, leading to vision loss.
Leukemia is a type of cancer that affects blood and bone marrow.
Rift Valley fever is a viral disease that affects animals and humans, caused by the Rift Valley fever virus.
NRDS is a condition seen in premature infants causing breathing difficulties.
Breast cancer is a malignancy that develops from breast tissue.
Legionellosis, or Legionnaires' disease, is a severe form of pneumonia caused by Legionella bacteria.
Hypothyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormones.
Botulism is a rare but serious illness caused by a toxin that attacks the body's nerves.
Eczema is a condition that makes the skin red, inflamed, and itchy.
Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy, blister-like rash.
Interstitial cystitis is a chronic condition causing bladder pressure, bladder pain, and sometimes pelvic pain.
Diabetic retinopathy is a diabetes complication that affects the eyes.
Chlamydia is a common sexually transmitted infection caused by bacteria.
Endometriosis is a disorder where tissue similar to the lining inside the uterus grows outside the uterus.
Asbestos-related diseases include lung cancer, mesothelioma, and asbestosis caused by asbestos exposure.
An ear infection is an inflammation of the middle ear, often caused by bacteria.
Trachoma is an infectious eye disease caused by Chlamydia trachomatis, leading to blindness if untreated.
Papilloedema is swelling of the optic disc due to increased intracranial pressure.
Cerebral palsy is a group of disorders affecting movement and muscle tone or posture caused by damage to the developing brain.
Rickets is a condition in children caused by vitamin D deficiency, leading to soft and weak bones.
Pelvic inflammatory disease is an infection of the female reproductive organs.
Necrotizing fasciitis is a severe bacterial infection that destroys tissues under the skin.
Mumps is a viral infection that affects the salivary glands.
Progeria is a rare genetic disorder causing accelerated aging in children.
Mononucleosis, or "mono," is an infectious disease caused by the Epstein-Barr virus.
Carbon monoxide poisoning occurs when carbon monoxide builds up in the bloodstream, preventing oxygen delivery to tissues.
Zika virus disease is a mosquito-borne illness causing fever, rash, and joint pain, and can lead to birth defects if contracted during pregnancy.
Colorectal cancer is cancer that starts in the colon or rectum.
Cancer is a disease where abnormal cells divide uncontrollably and destroy body tissue.
Scurvy is a disease resulting from a deficiency of vitamin C.
Vertigo is a sensation of spinning or dizziness often caused by inner ear problems.
Osteomyelitis is an infection in a bone.
Asthma is a chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and difficulty breathing.
Chorea is a movement disorder causing involuntary, unpredictable body movements.
Peritonitis is inflammation of the peritoneum, often due to bacterial infection.
Gonorrhea is a sexually transmitted bacterial infection.
Down's syndrome is a genetic disorder caused by the presence of an extra chromosome 21.
Iritis is inflammation of the iris, the colored part of the eye.
Alzheimer's disease is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder causing memory loss and cognitive decline.
A neoplasm is an abnormal growth of tissue, which can be benign or malignant.
Tetanus is a serious bacterial infection causing muscle stiffness and spasms.
CCHF is a tick-borne viral disease causing severe hemorrhagic fever.
Anaemia is a condition where there is a lack of red blood cells or hemoglobin.
Narcolepsy is a chronic sleep disorder characterized by overwhelming daytime drowsiness and sudden attacks of sleep.
Vasovagal syncope is a sudden drop in heart rate and blood pressure leading to fainting, often in response to a trigger.
Warts are small, non-cancerous growths on the skin caused by human papillomavirus (HPV).
Diabetes is a chronic condition affecting how the body processes blood sugar.
The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract.
Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver, commonly caused by viral infections.
Nipah virus infection is a zoonotic illness causing severe respiratory and neurological symptoms.
Parkinson's disease is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting movement.
Antepartum hemorrhage is bleeding from the genital tract in late pregnancy.
Inflammatory bowel disease includes chronic conditions like Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis causing inflammation of the digestive tract.
Cholera is an acute diarrheal illness caused by infection of the intestine with Vibrio cholerae bacteria.
Dry eye syndrome is a condition where the eyes do not produce enough tears or produce poor quality tears.

Presbyopia is the gradual loss of the eye's ability to focus on nearby objects with age.

Dehydration occurs when the body loses more fluids than it takes in.
Scabies is a contagious skin infestation caused by the mite Sarcoptes scabiei.
Gangrene is the death of body tissue due to a lack of blood flow or a serious infection.
Tay-Sachs disease is a genetic disorder that results in the destruction of nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.
Premenstrual syndrome is a group of symptoms that occur in women typically between ovulation and a period.
Smallpox is a contagious and deadly disease caused by the variola virus.
Yaws is a chronic bacterial infection affecting skin, bones, and joints, caused by Treponema pallidum.
Acute encephalitis syndrome is a condition characterized by inflammation of the brain, often due to infection.
Osteoarthritis is a degenerative joint disease causing cartilage breakdown and joint pain.
Neuralgia is intense, typically intermittent pain along the course of a nerve.
The Black Death was a devastating pandemic of bubonic plague that struck Europe and Asia in the 14th century.
Laryngitis is inflammation of the larynx, causing hoarseness or loss of voice.
Astigmatism is a common vision condition causing blurred vision due to an irregularly shaped cornea.
Blindness is the lack of vision, which can be partial or complete.

Nasal polyps are noncancerous growths on the lining of the nasal passages or sinuses.
Chronic fatigue syndrome is a disorder characterized by extreme fatigue that doesn't improve with rest.
A high-risk pregnancy is one where the mother, fetus, or both are at higher risk for complications.
Stomach ulcers are sores that develop on the lining of the stomach.
Trichomoniasis is a sexually transmitted infection caused by a parasite.
STIs are infections commonly spread through sexual contact.
Epilepsy is a neurological disorder marked by recurrent, unprovoked seizures.
Kuru is a rare and fatal neurodegenerative disorder caused by prion infection, historically found in Papua New Guinea.
Kala-azar, or visceral leishmaniasis, is a parasitic disease spread by sandfly bites.
Measles is a highly contagious viral disease causing fever, cough, and a characteristic rash.
Dracunculiasis is a parasitic infection caused by the guinea worm, leading to painful skin ulcers.
Muscular dystrophy is a group of genetic diseases causing progressive weakness and loss of muscle mass.
Dysentery is an infection of the intestines causing severe diarrhea with blood.
Irritable bowel syndrome is a chronic gastrointestinal disorder causing abdominal pain and altered bowel habits.
A bunion is a bony bump that forms on the joint at the base of the big toe.
Scarlet fever is a bacterial illness that develops in some people with strep throat.
Mastitis is inflammation of breast tissue, often caused by infection.
Shigellosis is an infectious disease caused by Shigella bacteria, leading to diarrhea, fever, and stomach cramps.
Congenital anomalies are structural or functional abnormalities present at birth.
Congestive heart disease is a condition where the heart's ability to pump blood is inadequate to meet the body's needs.
Diabetes mellitus is a group of diseases that affect how your body uses blood sugar (glucose).
Aseptic meningitis is inflammation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord, not caused by bacterial infection.
Dementia is a group of symptoms affecting memory, thinking, and social abilities severely enough to interfere with daily life.
Puerperal sepsis is a severe infection occurring in women after childbirth.
Cavities are permanently damaged areas in the hard surface of your teeth that develop into tiny openings or holes.
Bell's palsy is a condition causing sudden weakness or paralysis of the muscles on one side of the face.

Quinsy is a complication of tonsillitis where a pus-filled abscess forms near the tonsils.
Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) is the unexplained death of a seemingly healthy baby, usually during sleep.

Multiple myeloma is a cancer of plasma cells, a type of white blood cell in the bone marrow.
Frostbite is an injury caused by freezing of the skin and underlying tissues.

Mad cow disease, or bovine spongiform encephalopathy (BSE), is a fatal neurodegenerative disease in cattle.
Rheumatism is a general term for conditions causing chronic, often intermittent pain affecting the joints or connective tissue.
Toxic shock syndrome is a rare, life-threatening complication of certain bacterial infections.
Severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) is a viral respiratory illness caused by a coronavirus.
Anxiety disorders are characterized by excessive fear or worry.
Lactose intolerance is the inability to digest lactose, a sugar found in milk and dairy products.
Diphtheria is a serious bacterial infection affecting the mucous membranes of the throat and nose.
Beriberi is a disease caused by a deficiency of vitamin B1 (thiamine).
Candidiasis is a fungal infection caused by yeasts from the genus Candida.
Syphilis is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum.
Human papillomavirus (HPV) is a viral infection that can cause genital warts and cancers.
Myasthenia gravis is a chronic autoimmune neuromuscular disease causing weakness in the skeletal muscles.
Obsessive-compulsive disorder is a mental health disorder characterized by obsessive thoughts and compulsive actions.
Shaken baby syndrome is a serious brain injury resulting from forcefully shaking an infant or toddler.
Food poisoning is an illness caused by consuming contaminated food or drink.
Turner's syndrome is a chromosomal disorder affecting females, where one of the X chromosomes is missing or partially missing.
Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a common cardiovascular condition.
Pericarditis is inflammation of the pericardium, the fluid-filled sac surrounding the heart.
Adult inclusion conjunctivitis is an eye infection caused by Chlamydia trachomatis.
Trichinosis is a parasitic disease caused by eating raw or undercooked meat infected with Trichinella larvae.
Herpes simplex is a viral infection causing sores, most commonly around the mouth or genitals.
Schizophrenia is a chronic mental disorder affecting a person's ability to think, feel, and behave clearly.
Scrub typhus is a disease caused by a mite-borne bacterium, causing fever, headache, and rash.
Marburg fever is a severe hemorrhagic fever caused by the Marburg virus.
Sub-conjunctival hemorrhage is bleeding underneath the conjunctiva of the eye.
Peptic ulcer disease is a condition where open sores develop on the inside lining of the stomach and upper portion of the small intestine.
Ectopic pregnancy occurs when a fertilized egg implants and grows outside the main cavity of the uterus.
MERS-CoV is a viral respiratory illness caused by a coronavirus.
Keratoconus is a progressive eye disease causing the cornea to thin and bulge into a cone-like shape.
Raynaud's phenomenon is a condition where cold temperatures or stress cause blood vessel spasms, reducing blood flow to extremities.
Chagas disease is a tropical parasitic disease caused by Trypanosoma cruzi, transmitted by insects.
Post-herpetic neuralgia is a painful condition affecting nerve fibers and skin after a shingles outbreak.
Gaming disorder is characterized by impaired control over gaming, prioritizing gaming over other activities, and continuing gaming despite negative consequences.
Shin splints are pain along the shin bone due to overuse or repetitive stress.
Preeclampsia is a pregnancy complication characterized by high blood pressure and signs of damage to other organs.

Pulmonary embolism is a blockage in one of the pulmonary arteries in the lungs, usually caused by blood clots.
Halitosis is chronic bad breath, often caused by bacteria in the mouth.
Atrophy is the wasting away or reduction in size of an organ or tissue due to disease or lack of use.
Preterm birth occurs when a baby is born before 37 completed weeks of pregnancy.
Hand, foot, and mouth disease is a contagious viral illness causing sores in the mouth and a rash on the hands and feet.
Diarrhea is the condition of having at least three loose or liquid bowel movements each day.
AIDS is a chronic, potentially life-threatening condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).
Anisometropia is a condition where the two eyes have unequal refractive power.
Taeniasis is a parasitic infection caused by tapeworms in the intestine.
Poliomyelitis, or polio, is a viral disease that can affect nerves and lead to partial or full paralysis.
Acquired capillary hemangioma of the eyelid is a benign vascular tumor of the eyelid.
Rocky Mountain spotted fever is a bacterial disease spread by tick bites.
Varicose veins are swollen, twisted veins that are visible just under the surface of the skin, often in the legs.
An orbital dermoid is a benign cystic tumor in or around the eye.
Alopecia refers to hair loss from the scalp or other parts of the body.
Hypotonia is decreased muscle tone, often involving reduced strength.
Shingles is a viral infection causing a painful rash, reactivated from the chickenpox virus.
Sciatica is pain affecting the back, hip, and outer side of the leg, caused by compression of a spinal nerve root.
Leprosy is a chronic infectious disease caused by Mycobacterium leprae, affecting the skin and nerves.
Condyloma, or genital warts, is a sexually transmitted infection caused by certain types of HPV.
Burns are tissue damage caused by heat, chemicals, electricity, sunlight, or radiation.
Pinguecula is a benign growth on the conjunctiva of the eye.
Fibromyalgia is a chronic condition characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain and fatigue.
Sarcoidosis is an inflammatory disease where granulomas form in various organs, most commonly the lungs and lymph nodes.
Vitiligo is a condition causing loss of skin pigment, resulting in white patches.
Lung cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the lungs.
A chalazion is a slow-growing, painless lump in the eyelid caused by a blocked oil gland.
A corneal abrasion is a scratch on the cornea of the eye.
Hypermetropia, or farsightedness, is a common vision condition where distant objects can be seen more clearly than close ones.
Obesity is a medical condition characterized by excessive body fat.
Campylobacter infection is a bacterial infection causing gastroenteritis with diarrhea and abdominal cramps.
Early pregnancy loss, or miscarriage, is the loss of a pregnancy before 20 weeks.
Coronary heart disease is a condition where the coronary arteries become narrowed or blocked.
A cough is a reflex action to clear the airways of mucus and irritants.
Amblyopia, or lazy eye, is a vision development disorder where an eye fails to achieve normal visual acuity.
Aniseikonia is a condition where there is a significant difference in the perceived size of images between the two eyes.
Taeniasis is an intestinal infection by adult tapeworms, while cysticercosis occurs when larvae infect tissues.
Tennis elbow is a painful condition caused by overuse of the elbow.
Amoebiasis is an intestinal illness caused by the parasite Entamoeba histolytica.
Childhood exotropia is a condition where one or both eyes turn outward.
COPD is a group of lung diseases causing breathing difficulties, including emphysema and chronic bronchitis.
Kaposiís sarcoma is a cancer that causes lesions in the skin, lymph nodes, and other organs.
Eclampsia is a severe complication of pregnancy causing seizures.
Guillain-BarrÈ syndrome is a rare disorder where the immune system attacks the nerves.
Brucellosis is a bacterial infection spread from animals to humans, causing fever, joint pain, and fatigue.
Amaurosis fugax is a temporary loss of vision in one eye due to a lack of blood flow to the retina.
Cleft lip and cleft palate are congenital deformities where the lip or roof of the mouth does not form properly.
Sarcoma is a type of cancer that begins in bones and soft tissues.
Lice are small parasitic insects that infest the hair and scalp.
Tinnitus is the perception of noise or ringing in the ears.
Fibroids are benign tumors that grow in or on the uterus.
Myelitis is inflammation of the spinal cord.

Disease: Nausea and Vomiting of Pregnancy and  Hyperemesis gravidarum
Description: These are symptoms of pregnancy with severe cases known as hyperemesis gravidarum, causing extreme, persistent nausea and vomiting.
Osteoporosis is a condition where bones become weak and brittle.
Haemophilia is a genetic disorder affecting the blood's ability to clot.
